text: [Music]
the dogs I've seen who lived the longest
just have had somebody taking care of
their teeth at least some of their life
[Music]
we know from our own mouths that this is
a place that infection can get in people
who are having procedures done with
their dogs and they're under anaesthetic
that's a good time to get major dental
cleaning because you do have to put them
under an anaesthetic and I don't think
it's a great idea personally if they're
not already under anaesthetic to do that
just for the dental cleaning obviously
in the wild animals are not taking care
of their teeth except for by eating
things which get some of the plaque off
the teeth so there are actually hard
treats which are intended as a dental
chews you can brush their teeth and if
you start that early in their life they
probably are gonna be okay with that
there's toothpaste for dogs it tastes
like the types of things dogs like
having a mouth so do what you can
nobody's gonna floss their dog's teeth
as far as I can see but if you can brush
them once in a while I think you're
probably helping your dog
[Music]
